abstracts.cdata!:
Armenia's economy has undergone a
            profound transformation since independence in the early
            1990s. Today, it is market oriented and highly receptive to
            trade, capital, and technological innovation. From the late
            1990s to 2008, gross domestic product (GDP) expanded by
            double digits on average, and Armenia now ranks as a lower
            middle-income country. As a result of sustained growth,
            ambitious reforms, and external inflows of capital and
            remittances, poverty plunged from over 55 percent at the
            start of the transition to less than 36 percent in 2010.
